message.content:
cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.OH 

The paper deals with the problem of adaptively controlling and identifying a stochastic dynamical system, which is a topic that falls under the category of systems and control (cs.SY). The use of information-theoretic tools to analyze the problem suggests that it could also be classified under information theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the trade-off between the complexity of the uncertainty set and the amount of information acquired online, which is a topic that falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The use of Kolmogorov entropy to quantify a priori information suggests that the paper could also be classified under data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the paper presents a simple derivation of the minimum time needed to stabilize an uncertain stochastic linear system, which suggests that it could also be classified under other (cs.OH).
